channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Directs Military to Target Foreign Drug Cartels
item.description: The president has ordered the Pentagon to use the armed forces to carry out what in the past was considered law enforcement.

item.title: Why America’s jobs data may be getting it wrong
item.description: The rise of entrepreneurship and AI-driven solopreneurs is reshaping the labor market—but U.S. data hasn’t caught up.

item.title: Netanyahu, Aiming to Capture Gaza City, Risks Ending in Familiar Deadlock
item.description: Time and again, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel has pledged to defeat Hamas by force. The decision to capture Gaza City repeats a strategy...

item.title: Justice Department Subpoenas Office of Letitia James, a Trump Nemesis
item.description: Ms. James, New York’s attorney general, won a civil fraud case against President Trump that is on appeal. One of the two subpoenas is related to that ...

item.title: New Jersey Synagogue Burns to Ground as Rabbi and Family Escape
item.description: Congregation Beth El in Rutherford, more than a century old, was destroyed. The mayor said there was no indication of arson so far.

item.title: Stephen Miran, Trump’s Temporary Pick at the Fed, Could Have a Lasting Effect
item.description: Stephen I. Miran may spend only a few months on the central bank’s board of governors, but in that time he can influence the discussions around intere...

item.title: Gen Alpha has surpassed $100 billion in spending power from side hustles and bankrolling parents—and Roblox and Nike are among the big winners
item.description: “This generation has more spending money than you'd think,” DKC President Matthew Traub said. “Their economic influence is enormous.”

item.title: The U.S. military is looking to buy Tesla Cybertrucks to use as missile targets
item.description: "It is likely the type of vehicles used by the enemy may transition to Tesla Cyber trucks."

item.title: For the boomers that can actually afford to retire in the current climate, research reveals the best spots to kick up your feet
item.description: Retirees could settle down in sunny Cyprus, where rent for a 3-bedroom apartment in the city center is around $1,850.

item.title: What to know about Stephen Miran, the tariff proponent Trump just nominated to join the Fed’s board of governors
item.description: Miran is a rarity, a highly trained economist who makes a logical-sounding case for Trump’s stunningly contrarian game plan.

item.title: ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ in the Florida Everglades Is Testing Environmental Law
item.description: Officials building a Florida detention center appear to be skipping environmental reviews made mandatory decades ago after a fight over an airport at ...

item.title: Netanyahu Broadly Criticized at Home and Abroad After New Gaza Plan
item.description: International allies and families of hostages condemned Benjamin Netanyahu’s plan to take control of Gaza City, with the British prime minister callin...

item.title: India’s Modi Left Soul-Searching After Failed Courtships of Xi and Trump
item.description: The collapse of the Indian prime minister’s high-stakes personal efforts to transform India’s ties with the world’s two superpowers has exposed the li...

item.title: Israel Says It’s Preparing to Take Control of Gaza City. What Does That Mean?
item.description: The decision to expand operations in the enclave went against the recommendations of the military.
